content: - 23 -   To connect cyclical fluctuations in the level of aggregate activity with changes in   employment, Okun‚Äôs law has been proved useful as an empirical description of the   relationship between the output gap and the unemployment gap, ùë¢ùë¢ÔøΩ = ùë¢ùë¢‚àíùë¢ùë¢ ‚àó  ùë¢ùë¢‚àó  (see Knotek   (2007); and Daly, Fernald, Jord√†, and Nechio (2013, 2014)):     ùë¶ùë¶ÔøΩ = ‚àíùõæùõæùë¢ùë¢ÔøΩ .                 (Okun‚Äôs law)     (3)       To characterize monetary policy, it is nowadays useful to consider how the central   bank affects the level of interest rates by setting the federal funds rate, ùëñùëñ, in response to   deviations of expected inflation from its target, ùúãùúãÔøΩ = ùúãùúãùëíùëí ‚àí ùúãùúã‚àó (inflation gap), and percent   deviations of output from its potential level, ùë¶ùë¶ÔøΩ = ùë¶ùë¶‚àíùë¶ùë¶ ‚àó  ùë¶ùë¶‚àó  (output gap):     ùëñùëñ = ùëìùëìÔøΩùúãùúãùëíùëí ‚àí ùúãùúã‚àó,  ùë¶ùë¶ÔøΩÔøΩ.                       (4)     To capture the role of credit and financial intermediation in the economy,   consider a loan market equation, where the demand on the left-hand side depends   negatively on the borrowing rate, ùëñùëñùêµùêµ, and the level of economic activity (higher income   implies lower financing needs).  The supply of loans depends negatively on the level of   interest rates, ùëñùëñ, and positively on the level of intermediation spreads, ùúîùúî, and income, ùë¶ùë¶   (to the extent that higher aggregate income increases deposits and banks‚Äô capitalization   and hence the supplies of intermediated funds).  This equation pins down the equilibrium   level of the intermediation spread,ùúîùúî:     ùêøùêøùëëùëë(ùëñùëñùêµùêµ,ùë¶ùë¶) = ùêøùêøùë†ùë†ÔøΩùëñùëñ,ùúîùúî,  ùë¶ùë¶ÔøΩ.
